Key Match Events: Los Angeles Dodgers scored five unearned runs in the fifth inning due to errors by Aaron Judge and Anthony Volpe.
Gavin Lux and Mookie Betts hit sacrifice flies in the eighth inning to secure the win.
Aaron Judge and Jazz Chisholm Jr. hit back-to-back home runs in the first inning for New York.
Freddie Freeman hit a two-run single to tie the Series record of 12 RBIs, set by Bobby Richardson over seven games in 1960.
Post-Match Reflections: Aaron Judge expressed disappointment after the loss, stating, 'You can't give a good team like that extra outs.'
New York Yankees manager Aaron Boone said, 'Iâ€™m heartbroken.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: Los Angeles Dodgers won their eighth championship and seventh since leaving Brooklyn for Los Angeles.
Shohei Ohtani, despite going 2 for 19 with no RBIs, poured champagne on teammates after the win.
The Dodgers earned their first title in a non-shortened season since 1988.
The Yankees remain without a title since 2009.
